model.label: BSM Meter
model.description: Meter data which goes beyond the scope of an AC meter.

point.label: Error Code Meter
point.description: Meter module error code

point.label: Serial Number Meter
point.description: Serial number meter module
point.notes: This serial number is also provided as 'SN' in common model (1).

point.label: Serial Number Communication Module
point.description: Serial number of the meter's communication module

point.label: Software Version Meter
point.description: Meter firmware version and checksum
point.notes: This version informatin is also provided as 'Vr' in common model (1).

point.label: Software Version Communication Module
point.description: Communication module firmware version
point.notes: This version informatin is also provided as 'Vr' in common model (1).

point.label: Meter Address 1
point.description: Meter address 1

point.label: Meter Address 2
point.description: Meter address 2

point.label: Real Energy Exported Since Last Turn-On Sequence
point.description: Real energy exported since the last execution of the turn-on sequence
point.notes: This data point value gets reset to zero during the turn-on sequence.

point.label: Real Energy Exported Since Last Turn-On Sequence Scale Factor
Response Counter
point.description: A counter incremented with each snapshot
point.notes: This is a counter which gets incremented with and included in each created snapshot. It is used among all snapshot instances.

point.label: Current Epoch Time
point.description: Current local time in seconds since 1970
point.notes: Set both, 'Epoch' and 'TZO' in a single write operation for initially setting the time (if the time is invalid, for example after a power-up).

point.label: Timezone Offset
point.description: Timezone offset of local epoch time time to UTC
point.notes: Positive values refer to time zones east/ahead of UTC, negative values to time zones west/behind of UTC. Set both, 'Epoch' and 'TZO' in a single write operation for initially setting the time (if the time is invalid, for example after a power-up).

point.label: Time Set Counter
point.description: How many time epoch time and timezone offset have been set

point.label: Time Last Set At Operation-Seconds
point.description: Operation-seconds when the time has been set the last time

point.label: Digital Input State
point.description: Status of the digital inputs

point.label: Digital Output State
point.description: Status of the digital outputs

point.label: Digital Inputs Last Changed At Operation-Seconds
point.description: The point in time (operation-seconds) when the digital inputs changed last

point.label: Digital Inputs Last Changed At Epoch Time
point.description: The point in time (epoch time) when the digital inputs changed last

point.label: Digital Inputs Last Changed Timezone Offset
point.description: The timezone offset when digital input changed last

point.label: Digital Outputs Last Changed At Operation-Seconds
point.description: The point in time (operation-seconds) when the digital outputs changed last

point.label: Digital Outputs Last Changed At Epoch Time
point.description: The point in time (epoch time) when the digital outputs changed last

point.label: Digital Outputs Last Changed Timezone Offset
point.description: The timezone offset when digital outputs changed last

point.label: Metadata 1
point.description: User metadata 1
point.notes: Use this data point for including custom data into signed snapshots.

point.label: Metadata 2
point.description: User metadata 2
point.notes: Use this data point for including custom data into signed snapshots.

point.label: Metadata 3
point.description: User metadata 3
point.notes: Use this data point for including custom data into signed snapshots.

point.label: Signing Curve Name
point.description: The elliptic curve used for signing data

point.label: Number Of Public-Key Registers
point.description: The number of registers comprising the public key data

point.label: Pad
point.description: Pad register

point.label: Public Key
point.description: The meter's public key used for signing
point.notes: The public key covers all registers from its block. The first NPK/2 registers contain x, the last NPK/2 registers contain y in big endian.
